description: Tiny tool to apply a numpy boolean array to the spectral flags column of a measurement set to mask out known RFI sources like GSM and satelite in L-band. Typically flagging known RFI sources produces much better backgrounds and tools like the mighty AOFlagger RFI hammer needs fewer iterations to converge to good solutions.

parameters.info: A numpy array of shape [channels] containing a boolean
parameters.name: mask

parameters.info: Specifies whether mask should override current flags or be added (or) to the current
parameters.name: accumulation_mode

parameters.info: Computes and reports some statistics about the flagged RFI in the MS
parameters.name: statistics

parameters.info: Maximum memory to consume in MB for the flag buffer
parameters.name: memory
